Definition: A variable is a storage container. It has a name, a data type, and a value.
Integers are whole numbers. They can never have a decimal point.
A number is a numerical value with a decimal point.
A primitive variable is a variable that stores one of the four basic types of information: integers, numbers, booleans, or text.
An operator is a symbol that changes or combines pieces of data. The most common operators are math symbols like +, -, *, /, or mod.
